seed_viability.title: Seed Viability
seed_viability.instructions: Perform the flotation test: 1. Dissolve 100g salt in 1 liter water. 2. Put a sample of seeds in the solution. 3. Stir well and wait for 5 minutes. 4. Remove floating seeds (inviable). 5. Select only heavy seeds settled at the bottom.

market.subtitle: Real-time AI Market Intelligence
market.analyzing_desc: Our AI is crunching real-time mandi data and seasonal cycles.
market.optimization_desc: AI-powered harvesting cycles for maximum market impact. Coordinate your Mandi arrivals with peak ROI windows.
market.strategy_tip: Match harvest to "High ROI" indicators to bypass seasonal glut pricing.
market.pricing_desc: AI analysis suggests holding your turmeric stock for 3 more weeks to capitalize on a projected 15% price spike in the North Indian Mandis.
market.expert_tip_content: Always check the moisture content (MC) before taking grains to the Mandi. Lower MC often fetches a 5-10% premium.

step1.title: Step 1: Visual Seed Inspection
step1.instruction: Spread seeds on a clean surface. Look for cracks, black spots, fungus, or holes.
step1.warning: Warning: Damaged seeds have low germination priority.

step2.title: Step 2: Touch & Firmness Test
step2.instruction: Press seed gently. Firm = good. Soft/hollow = poor. For large seeds: Cut one seed → inside should be white/solid.

step3.title: Step 3: Water Float Test
step3.instruction: Put seeds in water for 5 minutes. Results logic: Sink = likely healthy, Float = remove.

step4.title: Step 4: Germination Test
step4.instruction: Place 50–100 seeds in wet cloth. Keep moist for 5–10 days. Count sprouts.

step5.title: Step 5: Strength Check
step5.instruction: Are sprouts strong and even? Weak sprouts indicate low energy reserves.

new_journey.title: New Mission
new_journey.subtitle: Architect a precise cultivation journey from seed to surplus.

c1.title: Wheat (Grade A)
c1.funFact: Wheat is the global staple that defined modern agriculture.
c1.waterInstruction: First irrigation at 20-25 DAS (CRI stage). Total 4-6 irrigations.
careTips: Maintain 21 days for CRI (Crown Root Initiation) stage
Monitor for Yellow Rust disease during cold spells
Apply nitrogen in three split doses for better grain filling

s1.title: Land Preparation & Soil Testing
s1.description: Deep ploughing (15-20cm), leveling, and collecting soil samples for pH and nutrient analysis. Remove weeds and previous crop residue. Test soil for nitrogen, phosphorus, potassium levels.

s2.title: Seed Selection & Treatment
s2.description: Select certified seeds (HD-2967, PBW-343) at 100kg/ha rate. Treat seeds with bio-fungicides like Trichoderma viride @ 4g/kg to protect from soil-borne diseases. Sun-dry treated seeds for 2 hours.

s3.title: Sowing & Spacing
s3.description: Sow seeds at 5cm depth using seed drill with row spacing of 20-22.5cm. Optimal sowing time: mid-October to mid-November. Ensure uniform seed distribution at 100kg/hectare.

s4.title: Initial Irrigation Setup
s4.description: First irrigation (Crown Root Initiation) at 20-25 days after sowing when 2-3 leaves appear. Use drip or flood irrigation. Apply 60mm water to establish deep root system.

s5.title: First Fertilizer Application
s5.description: Apply basal dose: 50% nitrogen (60kg Urea/ha), full phosphorus (50kg DAP/ha), full potash (40kg MOP/ha). Mix with soil before sowing or apply in furrows.

s6.title: Pest Monitoring & Weed Control
s6.description: Scout for aphids, termites, and armyworms weekly. Apply 2,4-D @ 500ml/ha for broadleaf weeds at 30-35 DAS. Use pheromone traps for early pest detection.

s7.title: Mid-Season Care & Tillering
s7.description: Apply second irrigation at tillering stage (40-45 DAS). Top dress with 25% nitrogen (30kg Urea) at this stage. Ensure 4-5 tillers per plant for optimal yield.

s8.title: Flowering & Grain Filling Support
s8.description: Critical irrigation at flowering (60-65 DAS) and milky stage (80-85 DAS). Apply remaining 25% nitrogen. Monitor for rust diseases and apply fungicide if detected.

s9.title: Pre-Harvest Assessment
s9.description: Check grain moisture (14-16%), golden color of stems, and hardness of grains by nail test. Stop irrigation 15 days before harvest. Plan harvesting logistics and machinery.

s10.title: Harvesting & Post-Harvest
s10.description: Harvest when grain moisture is 12-14% using combine harvester. Thresh within 24 hours. Dry grains to 10-12% moisture for storage. Store in moisture-proof containers.

c2.title: Basmati Rice
c2.funFact: The long grains and unique aroma are global exports.
c2.waterInstruction: Keep field moist/flooded (2-5 cm water level) until maturity.
careTips: Keep field flooded (2-5 cm) to suppress weed growth
Monitor for stem borer and leaf folder pests
Use organic manure during puddling for aroma enhancement

b1.title: Nursery Preparation
b1.description: Prepare well-ploughed raised bed nurseries 1.25m wide. Apply 20kg FYM and 50g each of N, P, K per 100m². Ensure proper drainage. Best nursery area: 1/20th of main field.

b2.title: Seed Selection & Treatment
b2.description: Use certified Basmati seeds (Pusa 1121, 1509) @ 30kg/ha. Soak in salt water (1.08 specific gravity) to remove half-filled seeds. Treat with Carbendazim @ 2g/kg or Trichoderma @ 5g/kg.

b3.title: Nursery Sowing & Care
b3.description: Sow sprouted seeds uniformly @ 100g/m². Keep beds moist, then maintain thin water layer. Seedlings ready for transplanting in 25-30 days (3-4 leaf stage).

b4.title: Main Field Puddling
b4.description: Puddle field with 5cm water, plough and cross-plough to mix mud. Level field precisely for uniform water depth. Apply basal dose: 50kg DAP, 30kg MOP per hectare before last puddling.

b5.title: Transplanting
b5.description: Transplant 25-30 day old seedlings @ 2-3 per hill at 20x15cm spacing. Plant 3-4cm deep in rows. Finish transplanting within 2-3 days of uprooting. Optimal time: June-July.

b6.title: Water Management & Early Care
b6.description: Maintain 5cm water for first 2 weeks, then follow alternate wetting and drying. Hand weed from 20 DAT. Apply first top dressing of 50kg Urea/ha 3 weeks after transplanting.

b7.title: Pest & Disease Monitoring
b7.description: Monitor weekly for stem borer, leaf folder, and BPH. Install 5 pheromone traps per hectare. Check for blast and sheath blight diseases.

b8.title: Panicle Initiation & Flowering Care
b8.description: Apply second top dressing of 30kg Urea at panicle initiation (day 45). Maintain continuous water during flowering. Spray 2% urea + micronutrients to boost grain filling.

b9.title: Pre-Harvest Preparation
b9.description: Drain water from field 15 days before harvest. Check grain moisture (20-22%) and 80% straw turning golden. Arrange harvester or labor.

b10.title: Harvesting & Post-Harvest
b10.description: Harvest when grain moisture is 20-22%. Thresh immediately to prevent discoloration. Sun dry on floor in thin layers to 14% moisture. Store in jute bags in cool, dry place.

c3.title: Cotton (Bt)
c3.funFact: India is the largest producer of cotton in the world.
c3.waterInstruction: 4-6 irrigations depending on rainfall. Critical at flowering.
careTips: Deep ploughing to control soil-borne pests
Square formation stage is critical for irrigation
Control whitefly and jassids for fiber quality

c4.title: Sugarcane
c4.funFact: India is the second largest producer of sugarcane globally.
c4.waterInstruction: Req 1500-2500 mm. Frequent during germination and tillering.
careTips: Earthing up at 3 and 5 months prevents lodging
Propping should be done to support heavy canes
Monitor for red rot and smut diseases

c5.title: Tomato
c5.funFact: India produces 20 million tonnes of tomatoes annually.
c5.waterInstruction: Weekly irrigation during summer. Avoid water on leaves.
careTips: Provide staking for indeterminate varieties
Regular pruning of side shoots enhances fruit size
Apply calcium nitrate to prevent blossom end rot

c6.title: Potato
c6.funFact: India is the second largest potato producer after China.
c6.waterInstruction: 7-10 day intervals. Critical during stolonization and bulking.
careTips: Earthing up is crucial to cover expanding tubers
Monitor for Late Blight in cloudy/humid weather
Stop irrigation 15 days before harvest for skin hardening

c7.title: Maize (Corn)
c7.funFact: Maize has the highest production potential among cereals.
c7.waterInstruction: Tasseling and silking stages are critical for moisture.
careTips: Maintain weed-free environment for first 45 days
Tasseling and silking are critical water stages
Monitor for Fall Armyworm (FAW) regularly

c8.title: Mustard
c8.funFact: India is the third largest mustard producer in the world.
c8.waterInstruction: 3-4 irrigations. Critical at rosette and pod filling.
careTips: Thinning at 20 days is essential for uniform growth
Sulfur application increases oil content significantly
Scout for mustard aphids during January-February

c9.title: Turmeric
c9.funFact: India satisfies over 75% of the total global demand for Turmeric.
c9.waterInstruction: Maintain consistent moisture. Avoid waterlogging at all costs.
careTips: Deep mulching with green leaves protects rhizomes
Perform earthing up twice at 60 and 90 days
Control shoot borer for healthy rhizome development
